result.value: OpenRefine is a free, open source power tool for working with messy data and improving it

OpenRefine is a Java-based power tool that allows you to load data, understand it,
clean it up, reconcile it, and augment it with data coming from
the web. All from a web browser and the comfort and privacy of your own computer.

OpenRefine is open source software and is licensed under the BSD license located in the [LICENSE.txt](LICENSE.txt). See the folders `licenses` under `/main/webapp/` as well as within each `/extensions` for information on open source libraries that OpenRefine depends on.
data-analysis, data-science, data-wrangling, datacleaning, datacleansing, datajournalism, datamining, java, journalism, opendata, reconciliation, wikidata

result.name: OpenRefine 3.9.3
result.description:
This is the fourth stable release of the 3.9 series. Please [backup your workspace directory](https://docs.openrefine.org/manual/installing#set-where-data-is-stored) before installing and report any problems that you encounter.

### Changes
- Enable custom clustering for non-GREL expressions (#7243) by @b2m 
- Identify syntax errors in Python expressions (#7217) by @SoryRawyer 
- Include `contextPath` when returning a redirect response (#7244) by @SoryRawyer 
- Fix deserialization of RowAdditionOperation (#7247) by @wetneb   

**Full changelog:** https://github.com/OpenRefine/OpenRefine/compare/3.9.2...3.9.3

result.name: OpenRefine 3.9.2
result.description:
This is the third stable release of the 3.9 series. Please [backup your workspace directory](https://docs.openrefine.org/manual/installing#set-where-data-is-stored) before installing and report any problems that you encounter.

### Changes

* Fixed (properly this time) a bug in French translation for the confirmation dialog about history erasure (#7143) by @wetneb
* Fix pagination controls and row range (#7211) by @SoryRawyer 
* Increase maximum cell size when importing a CSV file (#7219) by @wetneb
* Fix the "Edit all columns" menu in the presence of undone operations (#7218) by @wetneb

**Full Changelog**: https://github.com/OpenRefine/OpenRefine/compare/3.9.1...3.9.2

result.name: OpenRefine 3.9.1
result.description:
This is the second stable release of the 3.9 series. Please [backup your workspace directory](https://docs.openrefine.org/manual/installing#set-where-data-is-stored) before installing and report any problems that you encounter.

### Changes

* Fixed a bug in French translation for the confirmation dialog about history erasure (#7143)
* MacOS: update file permissions in DMG package (#7144)
* Fix pagination controls and row range (#7201)
* Disable maximum string length in Jackson (#7191)
* Show all column headers in full by default (#7168)

**Full Changelog**: https://github.com/OpenRefine/OpenRefine/compare/3.9.0...3.9.1

result.name: OpenRefine 3.9.0
result.description:
This is the first stable release of the 3.9 series. Please [backup your workspace directory](https://docs.openrefine.org/manual/installing#set-where-data-is-stored) before installing and report any problems that you encounter.

See [the release notes of 3.9-beta1](https://github.com/OpenRefine/OpenRefine/releases/tag/3.9-beta1) for an overview of the changes since OpenRefine 3.8.

Since 3.9-beta1, the following improvements have been made:
* Remove files from an earlier OpenRefine install in the Windows installer (#7123)
* Do not open the README.md file at the end of the Windows installation process (#7128)

The following webinar presents many of the new features in this release, with a focus on improvements around the newly developed [Wikimedia Commons](https://commons.wikimedia.org/wiki/Main_Page) integration:


[![Presentation video of the features released in
3.9](https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/2/2c/OpenRefine_3.9_Walkthrough.webm/800px--OpenRefine_3.9_Walkthrough.webm.jpg)](https://commons.wikimedia.org/wiki/File:OpenRefine_3.9_Walkthrough.webm)

result.name: OpenRefine 3.9-beta1
result.description:
This is the first beta release of the 3.9 series. Please [backup your workspace directory](https://docs.openrefine.org/manual/installing#set-where-data-is-stored) before installing and report any problems that you encounter.

## New features

* Import files using drag and drop. Closes #6250 by @Ahmed-Elgamel in https://github.com/OpenRefine/OpenRefine/pull/6438
* Ability to exclude candidates from a cluster. Closes #105 by @zyadtaha in https://github.com/OpenRefine/OpenRefine/pull/6448
* Support for user defined clustering distances and keyers by @zyadtaha in https://github.com/OpenRefine/OpenRefine/pull/6612
* The Wikibase editing operation reports editing results in the grid by @wetneb in https://github.com/OpenRefine/OpenRefine/pull/6555
* A dialog to warn of history entry deletion was added by @wetneb in https://github.com/OpenRefine/OpenRefine/pull/6659
* Add support for adding rows to a project by @steve-kasica in https://github.com/OpenRefine/OpenRefine/pull/6461
* Large media files can be uploaded to Wikimedia Commons and other Wikibases (#6510) by @sebastian-berlin-wmse in https://github.com/OpenRefine/OpenRefine/pull/6531
* A new GREL function (`levensthteinDistance`) to calculate the edit distance between two strings by @zyadtaha in https://github.com/OpenRefine/OpenRefine/pull/6755
* A new GREL `zip` function was introduced by @sunilnatraj in https://github.com/OpenRefine/OpenRefine/pull/6739
* Ability to handle dates in Jython expressions. Fixes #692 by @tfmorris in https://github.com/OpenRefine/OpenRefine/pull/6862
* Alphabetical/chronological sort for multi-file import by @elebitzero in https://github.com/OpenRefine/OpenRefine/pull/6844
* Resizeable columns (known to work imperfectly with the Edge browser, see #6932) by @wetneb in https://github.com/OpenRefine/OpenRefine/pull/6563
* Option to remove Blank Columns upon project creation by @wsmmxmm in https://github.com/OpenRefine/OpenRefine/pull/4757
* An extension mangement page by @Abbe98 in https://github.com/OpenRefine/OpenRefine/pull/7012
* Allow uploading new media file versions by @sebastian-berlin-wmse in https://github.com/OpenRefine/OpenRefine/pull/6967
* New "remove duplicate rows" operation by @sunilnatraj in https://github.com/OpenRefine/OpenRefine/pull/7040
* Search filter for Open Projects page by @Babi-B in https://github.com/OpenRefine/OpenRefine/pull/4690

## Enhancements
* Ignore JSON comments by default when importing JSON files by @zyadtaha in https://github.com/OpenRefine/OpenRefine/pull/6429
* Add module names to About page. Closes #5546 by @tfmorris in https://github.com/OpenRefine/OpenRefine/pull/6421
* New look and feel for the wikibase warnings. Closes #5702 by @t8210103 in https://github.com/OpenRefine/OpenRefine/pull/6535
* Switch release notification to openrefine.org and display other events by @wetneb in https://github.com/OpenRefine/OpenRefine/pull/6511
* The OpenRefine icon is compliant with new MacOS guidelines by @teolemon in https://github.com/OpenRefine/OpenRefine/pull/6592
* Improve localization of row/record count bar by @wetneb in https://github.com/OpenRefine/OpenRefine/pull/6648
* Replace PNG logo by SVG equivalent by @xinluz6 in https://github.com/OpenRefine/OpenRefine/pull/6620
* Preserve pagination after actions which trigger a grid update by @wetneb in https://github.com/OpenRefine/OpenRefine/pull/6546
* Limit Wikibase description length to 250 characters by @sebastian-berlin-wmse in https://github.com/OpenRefine/OpenRefine/pull/6853
* Avoid creating identical facets in reconciliation and Wikibase editing operations by @wetneb in https://github.com/OpenRefine/OpenRefine/pull/6865
* wikibase: More precise editing error messages by @wetneb in https://github.com/OpenRefine/OpenRefine/pull/6872
* wikibase: Render property names in issue reports #6768 by @sunilnatraj in https://github.com/OpenRefine/OpenRefine/pull/6895
* Move error reporting in apply-operations dialog away from alert into dialog by @wetneb in https://github.com/OpenRefine/OpenRefine/pull/6904
* Make the client link clickable in terminals by @Abbe98 in https://github.com/OpenRefine/OpenRefine/pull/6976
* Update refine.ini for `REFINE_INTERFACE` by @antoine2711 in https://github.com/OpenRefine/OpenRefine/pull/6983
* Adds the reconciliation service logo to column header and while schema building by @ayushrai206 in https://github.com/OpenRefine/OpenRefine/pull/6156
* Set a delay between opening submenu and hover. Fixes #6672 by @Shubham-M-Rathod in https://github.com/OpenRefine/OpenRefine/pull/6965
* Mark tables used for layout as presentational by @Abbe98 in https://github.com/OpenRefine/OpenRefine/pull/7003
* Wikibase: proxy manifest requests by @Abbe98 in https://github.com/OpenRefine/OpenRefine/pull/6136
* wikibase: Only ignore file upload warnings for matched cells by @wetneb in https://github.com/OpenRefine/OpenRefine/pull/7031
* Add escape() function options to escape URL path and fragment by @sunilnatraj in https://github.com/OpenRefine/OpenRefine/pull/6715
* wikibase: Improve recon name for created entities by @sunilnatraj in https://github.com/OpenRefine/OpenRefine/pull/7053

## Bug fixes
* The replace dialog works when the strings involved contain double quotes (Fixes #6367) by @surajbora59 in https://github.com/OpenRefine/OpenRefine/pull/6374
* Improve error reporting when parsing incomplete GREL expressions by @surajbora59 in https://github.com/OpenRefine/OpenRefine/pull/6368
* Better report importer initialization errors. Fixes #6058 by @tfmorris in https://github.com/OpenRefine/OpenRefine/pull/6370
* Correct the reconciliation documentation link display type by @Abbe98 in https://github.com/OpenRefine/OpenRefine/pull/6184
* Fix recon dialog suggested types radio button by @Redeem-Grimm-Satoshi in https://github.com/OpenRefine/OpenRefine/pull/6397
* Fix swapped button labels in wikibase schema editor by @Redeem-Grimm-Satoshi in https://github.com/OpenRefine/OpenRefine/pull/6415
* Fix inconsistent Extract/Apply button location by @Redeem-Grimm-Satoshi in https://github.com/OpenRefine/OpenRefine/pull/6450
* Support localized numbers in import settings. Fixes OpenRefine#6351 by @Xiayucheng1212 in https://github.com/OpenRefine/OpenRefine/pull/6358
* Fix encoding guesser for non-UTF-8 BOM-based files. Fixes #6595 by @tfmorris in https://github.com/OpenRefine/OpenRefine/pull/6596
* recon: Add back missing 'search for match' button by @wetneb in https://github.com/OpenRefine/OpenRefine/pull/6600
* grel: Fix NullPointerException in forEachIndex by @tfmorris in https://github.com/OpenRefine/OpenRefine/pull/6606
* Make join handling of empty strings consistent even if they are first in array by @tfmorris in https://github.com/OpenRefine/OpenRefine/pull/6605
* wikibase: Better handling of the 'badtags' error by @wetneb in https://github.com/OpenRefine/OpenRefine/pull/6552
* Fix join() of arrays containing nulls. Fixes #6683 by @tfmorris in https://github.com/OpenRefine/OpenRefine/pull/6684
* Solve Excel importing from URL problem. Fixes #6418 by @Kurocifer in https://github.com/OpenRefine/OpenRefine/pull/6537
* Fix type of error message returned by the Filter GREL control by @sunil-atheer in https://github.com/OpenRefine/OpenRefine/pull/6701
* grel: Integer divide by zero returning null instead of infinity by @Kurocifer in https://github.com/OpenRefine/OpenRefine/pull/6708
* Increase TSV/CSV column limit to 32K (from 512). Fixes #6723 by @tfmorris in https://github.com/OpenRefine/OpenRefine/pull/6757
* The saving of text files on MacOS Sonoma was fixed. Fixes #6549 by @tfmorris in https://github.com/OpenRefine/OpenRefine/pull/6749
* fix: Ensure thread safety of Wikibase date parsing by @wetneb in https://github.com/OpenRefine/OpenRefine/pull/6779
* Fix cursor appearance when hovering tabs. Closes #6764 by @GittyHarsha in https://github.com/OpenRefine/OpenRefine/pull/6811
* Fix misplaced edit button for empty cells. Closes #5989 by @GittyHarsha in https://github.com/OpenRefine/OpenRefine/pull/6812
* File type detection fails when multiple files are imported at once by @sunilnatraj in https://github.com/OpenRefine/OpenRefine/pull/6788
* Fix Uncaught RangeError when using Cell Edit button to change String to Date data type. by @GittyHarsha in https://github.com/OpenRefine/OpenRefine/pull/6823
* wikibase: Fix NPE when empty edits are scheduled by @wetneb in https://github.com/OpenRefine/OpenRefine/pull/6776
* Turn on line separator detection for CSV/TSV import. Fixes #6691 by @tfmorris in https://github.com/OpenRefine/OpenRefine/pull/6790
* add documentation for `toTitleCase()` second argument (delimiters) by @akashinde in https://github.com/OpenRefine/OpenRefine/pull/6846
* Add error reporting to JSON preview parse. Fixes #6454 by @tfmorris in https://github.com/OpenRefine/OpenRefine/pull/6912
* Add missing backslash escaping in duplicate facet expression by @wetneb in https://github.com/OpenRefine/OpenRefine/pull/6910
* The `toString` GREL function correctly returns an error when formatting template and arguments are inconsistent. Fixes #6943 by @tfmorris in https://github.com/OpenRefine/OpenRefine/pull/6946
* ODS file incorrectly recognized as XLS #6877 by @sunilnatraj in https://github.com/OpenRefine/OpenRefine/pull/6880
* Fix resultSummary div in Clustering dialog has unnecessary squishyness by @himanshubhatt0512 in https://github.com/OpenRefine/OpenRefine/pull/6845
* Fix an inadequate rate-limiting when editing Wikimedia Commons by @sunilnatraj in https://github.com/OpenRefine/OpenRefine/pull/6969
* Really fix QuickStatements export this time by @wetneb in https://github.com/OpenRefine/OpenRefine/pull/7016
* Fix opening of CSV files with many columns. Closes issue #7038 by @CAMB-dev in https://github.com/OpenRefine/OpenRefine/pull/7041
* Minor fixes to translatable files by @SannitaSSJ in https://github.com/OpenRefine/OpenRefine/pull/7075
* fix: Deserialization of old cell splitting operation by @wetneb in https://github.com/OpenRefine/OpenRefine/pull/7079

## Extension changes

* The Google Data integration was removed. It can be added back by installing the [refine-gdata-extension](https://github.com/wetneb/refine-gdata-extension) which is now maintained in a standalone repository. By @wetneb in https://github.com/OpenRefine/OpenRefine/pull/6958

## Extension compatibility
* Remove use of Properties for URL query parsing, fixes #6403 by @EliasStihl in https://github.com/OpenRefine/OpenRefine/pull/6407
* Extend Exporter interfaces to phase out use of Properties by @tfmorris in https://github.com/OpenRefine/OpenRefine/pull/6796
* Remove Denormalize operation by @wetneb in https://github.com/OpenRefine/OpenRefine/pull/6468
* Provide slf4j-api & jackson to extension modules. Fixes #6475 by @tfmorris in https://github.com/OpenRefine/OpenRefine/pull/6478
* Drop legacy Keyer classes not registered as clustering methods by @wetneb in https://github.com/OpenRefine/OpenRefine/pull/6486
* Move Keyer and Distance registration to controller.js by @wetneb in https://github.com/OpenRefine/OpenRefine/pull/6487
* Avoid crashing when a cell renderer throws an exception by @wetneb in https://github.com/OpenRefine/OpenRefine/pull/6514
* Move exporter registration to controller.js by @wetneb in https://github.com/OpenRefine/OpenRefine/pull/6504
* Package Java classes into jars by @wetneb in https://github.com/OpenRefine/OpenRefine/pull/6513
* Drop 'sample' extension. by @wetneb in https://github.com/OpenRefine/OpenRefine/pull/6484
* Remove grel registration from RefineTest by @wetneb in https://github.com/OpenRefine/OpenRefine/pull/6574
* Fix class mapping mechanism broken by the migration to Jackson by @wetneb in https://github.com/OpenRefine/OpenRefine/pull/6480
* Restore public API of reconciliation classes. Fixes #6652 by @tfmorris in https://github.com/OpenRefine/OpenRefine/pull/6653
* The meaning of the `start` parameter in the `get-rows` command was changed by @wetneb in https://github.com/OpenRefine/OpenRefine/pull/6546
* Separate 'core' and 'grel' Maven modules by @wetneb in https://github.com/OpenRefine/OpenRefine/pull/6651
* Fix CSRF token fetching utility (and Wikibase login) by @wetneb in https://github.com/OpenRefine/OpenRefine/pull/6945
* Assign different cascade layers to CSS from different modules by @Abbe98 in https://github.com/OpenRefine/OpenRefine/pull/6981
* Deprecate EngineConfig::reconstruct by @wetneb in https://github.com/OpenRefine/OpenRefine/pull/7033
* operations: Let core and extensions register icons by @wetneb in https://github.com/OpenRefine/OpenRefine/pull/7055

## New code contributors
* @Redeem-Grimm-Satoshi made their first contribution in https://github.com/OpenRefine/OpenRefine/pull/6397
* @EliasStihl made their first contribution in https://github.com/OpenRefine/OpenRefine/pull/6407

* @pkumar2001 made their first contribution in https://github.com/OpenRefine/OpenRefine/pull/6476

* @DaxServer made their first contribution in https://github.com/OpenRefine/OpenRefine/pull/6593
* @dino2580 made their first contribution in https://github.com/OpenRefine/OpenRefine/pull/6626
* @teolemon made their first contribution in https://github.com/OpenRefine/OpenRefine/pull/6592
* @Kurocifer made their first contribution in https://github.com/OpenRefine/OpenRefine/pull/6537
* @sunil-atheer made their first contribution in https://github.com/OpenRefine/OpenRefine/pull/6701
* @steve-kasica made their first contribution in https://github.com/OpenRefine/OpenRefine/pull/6461
* @xinluz6 made their first contribution in https://github.com/OpenRefine/OpenRefine/pull/6620

result.name: OpenRefine 3.8.7
result.description:
This release fixes an issue (#6977) which prevents exporting Wikidata QuickStatements in OpenRefine 3.8.5 and 3.8.4, as well as an issue (#6941) which prevents login to Wikidata with OpenRefine 3.8.4. This release includes the same collection of important vulnerability fixes as 3.8.4. We encourage users to upgrade swiftly. It also fixes an issue (#7001) in 3.8.6 where the update banner was always displayed. It is otherwise identical to 3.8.6.

To continue using the Google Drive and Google Sheets integration, users need to [obtain their own application credentials from the Google API Console](https://github.com/OpenRefine/OpenRefine/wiki/Google-Extension).

**Note:** the vulnerability fixes were originally released as 3.8.3 but that version is dysfunctional due to human errors in the release process. The description of the vulnerabilities is included again here for visibility.

## Vulnerabilities in OpenRefine

* PreviewExpressionCommand, which is eval, lacks protection against cross-site request forgery (CSRF).
   [CVE-2024-47879](https://www.cve.org/CVERecord?id=CVE-2024-47879), [GHSA-3jm4-c6qf-jrh3](https://github.com/OpenRefine/OpenRefine/security/advisories/GHSA-3jm4-c6qf-jrh3). Reported by @wandernauta, fix by @wetneb.
* Reflected cross-site scripting vulnerability (XSS) from POST request in ExportRowsCommand. Severity: high. [CVE-2024-47880](https://www.cve.org/CVERecord?id=CVE-2024-47880), [GHSA-79jv-5226-783f](https://github.com/OpenRefine/OpenRefine/security/advisories/GHSA-79jv-5226-783f). Reported by @wandernauta, fix by @wetneb.
* Error page lacks escaping, leading to potential XSS on import of malicious project. Severity: moderate. [CVE-2024-47882](https://www.cve.org/CVERecord?id=CVE-2024-47882), [GHSA-j8hp-f2mj-586g](https://github.com/OpenRefine/OpenRefine/security/advisories/GHSA-j8hp-f2mj-586g)
* Directory slip in LoadLanguageCommand. Severity: high. [GHSA-qfwq-6jh6-8xx4](https://github.com/OpenRefine/OpenRefine/security/advisories/GHSA-qfwq-6jh6-8xx4). Reported and fixed by @wetneb.

## Vulnerabilities in bundled extensions

* **gdata**: Reflected cross-site scripting vulnerability (XSS) in `authorized.vt`. [CVE-2024-47878](https://www.cve.org/CVERecord?id=CVE-2024-47878), [GHSA-pw3x-c5vp-mfc3](https://github.com/OpenRefine/OpenRefine/security/advisories/GHSA-pw3x-c5vp-mfc3). Reported by @wandernauta, fix by @wetneb.
* **gdata**: leak of OAuth application credentials. Severity: high. [GHSA-3pg4-qwc8-426r](https://github.com/OpenRefine/OpenRefine/security/advisories/GHSA-3pg4-qwc8-426r). Reported and fixed by @wetneb.
* **database**: SQLite integration allows filesystem access, remote code execution (RCE). Severity: high. [CVE-2024-47881](https://www.cve.org/CVERecord?id=CVE-2024-47881), [GHSA-87cf-j763-vvh8](https://github.com/OpenRefine/OpenRefine/security/advisories/GHSA-87cf-j763-vvh8). Reported by @wandernauta, fix by @wetneb.

## Vulnerabilities in Butterfly (web framework used in OpenRefine)

*  Path/URL confusion in resource handling leading to multiple weaknesses. Severity: critical. [CVE-2024-47883](https://www.cve.org/CVERecord?id=CVE-2024-47883). [GHSA-3p8v-w8mr-m3x8](https://github.com/OpenRefine/simile-butterfly/security/advisories/GHSA-3p8v-w8mr-m3x8). Reported by @wandernauta, fix by @wetneb.
* parseJSON, getJSON functions eval malicious input, leading to remote code execution (RCE). Severity: moderate. [GHSA-mpcw-3j5p-p99x](https://github.com/OpenRefine/simile-butterfly/security/advisories/GHSA-mpcw-3j5p-p99x). Reported by @wandernauta, fix by @wetneb.

Special thanks to @wandernauta for the hard work that went into analyzing and reporting those vulnerabilities responsibly and to @tfmorris for reviewing mitigations.

**Full Changelog**: https://github.com/OpenRefine/OpenRefine/compare/3.8.5...3.8.6

This release fixes an issue (#6977) which prevents exporting Wikidata QuickStatements in OpenRefine 3.8.5 and 3.8.4, as well as an issue (#6941) which prevents login to Wikidata with OpenRefine 3.8.4. This release includes the same collection of important vulnerability fixes as 3.8.4. We encourage users to upgrade swiftly.

To continue using the Google Drive and Google Sheets integration, users need to [obtain their own application credentials from the Google API Console](https://github.com/OpenRefine/OpenRefine/wiki/Google-Extension).

**Note:** the vulnerability fixes were originally released as 3.8.3 but that version is dysfunctional due to human errors in the release process. The description of the vulnerabilities is included again here for visibility.

* PreviewExpressionCommand, which is eval, lacks protection against cross-site request forgery (CSRF).

Reported by @wandernauta, fix by @wetneb.
* Error page lacks escaping, leading to potential XSS on import of malicious project. Severity: moderate. [CVE-2024-47882](https://www.cve.org/CVERecord?id=CVE-2024-47882), [GHSA-j8hp-f2mj-586g](https://github.com/OpenRefine/OpenRefine/security/advisories/GHSA-j8hp-f2mj-586g)
* Directory slip in LoadLanguageCommand. Severity: high. [GHSA-qfwq-6jh6-8xx4](https://github.com/OpenRefine/OpenRefine/security/advisories/GHSA-qfwq-6jh6-8xx4). Reported and fixed by @wetneb.

## Vulnerabilities in bundled extensions

* **gdata**: Reflected cross-site scripting vulnerability (XSS) in `authorized.vt`. [CVE-2024-47878](https://www.cve.org/CVERecord?id=CVE-2024-47878), [GHSA-pw3x-c5vp-mfc3](https://github.com/OpenRefine/OpenRefine/security/advisories/GHSA-pw3x-c5vp-mfc3). Reported by @wandernauta, fix by @wetneb.
* **gdata**: leak of OAuth application credentials. Severity: high. [GHSA-3pg4-qwc8-426r](https://github.com/OpenRefine/OpenRefine/security/advisories/GHSA-3pg4-qwc8-426r). Reported and fixed by @wetneb.
* **database**: SQLite integration allows filesystem access, remote code execution (RCE). Severity: high. [CVE-2024-47881](https://www.cve.org/CVERecord?id=CVE-2024-47881), [GHSA-87cf-j763-vvh8](https://github.com/OpenRefine/OpenRefine/security/advisories/GHSA-87cf-j763-vvh8). Reported by @wandernauta, fix by @wetneb.

## Vulnerabilities in Butterfly (web framework used in OpenRefine)

*  Path/URL confusion in resource handling leading to multiple weaknesses. Severity: critical. [CVE-2024-47883](https://www.cve.org/CVERecord?id=CVE-2024-47883). [GHSA-3p8v-w8mr-m3x8](https://github.com/OpenRefine/simile-butterfly/security/advisories/GHSA-3p8v-w8mr-m3x8). Reported by @wandernauta, fix by @wetneb.
* parseJSON, getJSON functions eval malicious input, leading to remote code execution (RCE). Severity: moderate. [GHSA-mpcw-3j5p-p99x](https://github.com/OpenRefine/simile-butterfly/security/advisories/GHSA-mpcw-3j5p-p99x). Reported by @wandernauta, fix by @wetneb.

Special thanks to @wandernauta for the hard work that went into analyzing and reporting those vulnerabilities responsibly and to @tfmorris for reviewing mitigations.

**Full Changelog**: https://github.com/OpenRefine/OpenRefine/compare/3.8.5...3.8.6

result.name: OpenRefine 3.8.5
result.description:
This release fixes an issue (#6941) which prevents login to Wikidata with OpenRefine 3.8.4. This release includes the same collection of important vulnerability fixes as 3.8.4. We encourage users to upgrade swiftly.

To continue using the Google Drive and Google Sheets integration, users need to [obtain their own application credentials from the Google API Console](https://github.com/OpenRefine/OpenRefine/wiki/Google-Extension).

**Note:** the vulnerability fixes were originally released as 3.8.3 but that version is dysfunctional due to human errors in the release process. The description of the vulnerabilities is included again here for visibility.

## Vulnerabilities in OpenRefine

* PreviewExpressionCommand, which is eval, lacks protection against cross-site request forgery (CSRF).
   [CVE-2024-47879](https://www.cve.org/CVERecord?id=CVE-2024-47879), [GHSA-3jm4-c6qf-jrh3](https://github.com/OpenRefine/OpenRefine/security/advisories/GHSA-3jm4-c6qf-jrh3). Reported by @wandernauta, fix by @wetneb.
* Reflected cross-site scripting vulnerability (XSS) from POST request in ExportRowsCommand. Severity: high. [CVE-2024-47880](https://www.cve.org/CVERecord?id=CVE-2024-47880), [GHSA-79jv-5226-783f](https://github.com/OpenRefine/OpenRefine/security/advisories/GHSA-79jv-5226-783f). Reported by @wandernauta, fix by @wetneb.
* Error page lacks escaping, leading to potential XSS on import of malicious project. Severity: moderate. [CVE-2024-47882](https://www.cve.org/CVERecord?id=CVE-2024-47882), [GHSA-j8hp-f2mj-586g](https://github.com/OpenRefine/OpenRefine/security/advisories/GHSA-j8hp-f2mj-586g)
* Directory slip in LoadLanguageCommand. Severity: high. [GHSA-qfwq-6jh6-8xx4](https://github.com/OpenRefine/OpenRefine/security/advisories/GHSA-qfwq-6jh6-8xx4). Reported and fixed by @wetneb.

## Vulnerabilities in bundled extensions

* **gdata**: Reflected cross-site scripting vulnerability (XSS) in `authorized.vt`. [CVE-2024-47878](https://www.cve.org/CVERecord?id=CVE-2024-47878), [GHSA-pw3x-c5vp-mfc3](https://github.com/OpenRefine/OpenRefine/security/advisories/GHSA-pw3x-c5vp-mfc3). Reported by @wandernauta, fix by @wetneb.
* **gdata**: leak of OAuth application credentials. Severity: high. [GHSA-3pg4-qwc8-426r](https://github.com/OpenRefine/OpenRefine/security/advisories/GHSA-3pg4-qwc8-426r). Reported and fixed by @wetneb.
* **database**: SQLite integration allows filesystem access, remote code execution (RCE). Severity: high. [CVE-2024-47881](https://www.cve.org/CVERecord?id=CVE-2024-47881), [GHSA-87cf-j763-vvh8](https://github.com/OpenRefine/OpenRefine/security/advisories/GHSA-87cf-j763-vvh8). Reported by @wandernauta, fix by @wetneb.

## Vulnerabilities in Butterfly (web framework used in OpenRefine)

*  Path/URL confusion in resource handling leading to multiple weaknesses. Severity: critical. [CVE-2024-47883](https://www.cve.org/CVERecord?id=CVE-2024-47883). [GHSA-3p8v-w8mr-m3x8](https://github.com/OpenRefine/simile-butterfly/security/advisories/GHSA-3p8v-w8mr-m3x8). Reported by @wandernauta, fix by @wetneb.
* parseJSON, getJSON functions eval malicious input, leading to remote code execution (RCE). Severity: moderate. [GHSA-mpcw-3j5p-p99x](https://github.com/OpenRefine/simile-butterfly/security/advisories/GHSA-mpcw-3j5p-p99x). Reported by @wandernauta, fix by @wetneb.

Special thanks to @wandernauta for the hard work that went into analyzing and reporting those vulnerabilities responsibly and to @tfmorris for reviewing mitigations.

**Full Changelog**: https://github.com/OpenRefine/OpenRefine/compare/3.8.4...3.8.5

result.name: OpenRefine v3.8.2
result.description:
This is the third stable release of the 3.8 series. Please [backup your workspace directory](https://docs.openrefine.org/manual/installing#set-where-data-is-stored) before installing and report any problems that you encounter.

## Changes
* Fixed the checking of whether OpenRefine is running on Linux when curl is absent ([#6622](https://github.com/OpenRefine/OpenRefine/issues/6622)) by @dino2580
* Fixed the opening of the browser for platforms where the Desktop.browse API is not supported ([#6600](https://github.com/OpenRefine/OpenRefine/issues/6660)) by @wetneb
* Fixed the preservation of the position in the grid when matching a single cell to a reconciliation candidate ([#6695](https://github.com/OpenRefine/OpenRefine/issues/6695)) by @wetneb

**Full Changelog**: https://github.com/OpenRefine/OpenRefine/compare/3.8.1...3.8.2

result.name: OpenRefine v3.8.1
result.description:
This is the second stable release of the 3.8 series. Please [backup your workspace directory](https://docs.openrefine.org/manual/installing#set-where-data-is-stored) before installing and report any problems that you encounter.

## Changes

For an overview of the main changes since 3.7, refer to [the changelog for 3.8-beta1](https://github.com/OpenRefine/OpenRefine/releases/tag/3.8-beta1). This lists the changes since 3.8.0.

* Add back missing 'search for match' button in reconciled cells (#6599) by @wetneb
* Fix encoding guesser for non-UTF-8 BOM-based files (#6595) by @tfmorris
* Fix project name lookup with missing metadata (#6453) by @tfmorris

result.name: OpenRefine v3.8.0
result.description:
This is the first stable release of the 3.8 series. Please [backup your workspace directory](https://docs.openrefine.org/manual/installing#set-where-data-is-stored) before installing and report any problems that you encounter.

## Changes

* Improve new release notification for better flexibility and privacy (#6511) by @wetneb

result.name: OpenRefine v3.8-beta5
result.description:
This is the second beta release of the 3.8 series (version numbers `3.8-beta2` , `3.8-beta3` and `3.8-beta4` are skipped because of publishing problems). Please [backup your workspace directory](https://docs.openrefine.org/manual/installing#set-where-data-is-stored) before installing and report any problems that you encounter.

## Changes

* Improve separator guessing for CSV/TSV files (#6516) by @tfmorris 
* Avoid crashing when cell renderer throws an exception (workaround for https://github.com/OpenRefine/CommonsExtension/issues/99) by @wetneb
* Fix recon deserialization error for matched cells (#6464) by @wetneb
* Normalize the ordering of "OK" / "Cancel" buttons in dialogs (#6353) by @zyadtaha 
* Removed grey background from <button> (#6440) by @abhishekkujur1307 
* Correct the behavior of cell editing when confirming single cell changes with "Enter" (#6406) by @WR-Smiley
* Package Java classes into jar archives (#6257) by @wetneb

result.name: OpenRefine v3.8-beta1
result.description:
This is the first beta release of the 3.8 series. Please [backup your workspace directory](https://docs.openrefine.org/manual/installing#set-where-data-is-stored) before installing and report any problems that you encounter.

## New features and improvements

### Keyboard navigation improvements
  * Dialogs are focusable ([#5578](https://github.com/OpenRefine/OpenRefine/pull/5578), by @Abbe98)
  * The tab order for reconciliation create and match buttons is fixed ([#5685](https://github.com/OpenRefine/OpenRefine/pull/5685), by @Abbe98)
  * The show/hide left panel is keyboard accessible ([#5852](https://github.com/OpenRefine/OpenRefine/pull/5852), by @Abbe98)
  * Menu buttons in the extension-bar can be opened with the keyboard ([#5853](https://github.com/OpenRefine/OpenRefine/pull/5853), by @Abbe98)
  * Tab buttons are outlined when focused ([#5851](https://github.com/OpenRefine/OpenRefine/pull/5851), by @Abbe98)
  * The element outlines set by the browser are retained ([#5867](https://github.com/OpenRefine/OpenRefine/pull/5867), by @Abbe98)
  * The project permalink can be selected ([#5871](https://github.com/OpenRefine/OpenRefine/pull/5871), by @Abbe98)
  * The button to rename a project can be selected  ([#5868](https://github.com/OpenRefine/OpenRefine/pull/5868), by @Abbe98)
  * The column header buttons are selectable/openable by keyboard ([#5854](https://github.com/OpenRefine/OpenRefine/pull/5854), by @Abbe98)
  * Make action area tabs selectable by keyboard ([#5885](https://github.com/OpenRefine/OpenRefine/pull/5885), by @Abbe98)
  * Make it possible to set custom headers using only the keyboard when fetching urls ([#5886](https://github.com/OpenRefine/OpenRefine/pull/5886), by @Abbe98)
  * The menu system is navigable by keyboard ([#5901](https://github.com/OpenRefine/OpenRefine/pull/5901), by @Abbe98)
  * The "Get data from" menu is keyboard accessible ([#5900](https://github.com/OpenRefine/OpenRefine/pull/5900), by @Abbe98)
  * Cells in the grid can be edited by keyboard ([#5855](https://github.com/OpenRefine/OpenRefine/pull/5855), by @Abbe98)

### Reconciliation usability improvements
  * The waiting screen while guessing reconciliation types is internal to the reconciliation dialog ([#4877](https://github.com/OpenRefine/OpenRefine/issues/4877), by @ayushrai206)
  * The "auto-match" checkbox persists after restarts of OpenRefine ([#4722](https://github.com/OpenRefine/OpenRefine/issues/4722), by @ayushrai206)
  * The documentation of the reconciliation service is displayed in the reconciliation dialog (if available) ([#5784](https://github.com/OpenRefine/OpenRefine/pull/5784), by @ayushriai206)
  * The default types supplied by the reconciliation service are always offered to users ([#4224](https://github.com/OpenRefine/OpenRefine/issues/4224), by @ayushrai206)
  * The reconciliation types are displayed with both name and id ([#5907](https://github.com/OpenRefine/OpenRefine/issues/5907), by @ayushrai206)
  * OpenRefine honours the batch size announced by reconciliation services ([#5603](https://github.com/OpenRefine/OpenRefine/issues/5603), by @ayushrai206)
  * The dialog for the operation to add a column of entity identifiers is improved ([#5998](https://github.com/OpenRefine/OpenRefine/issues/5998), by @elebitzero)
  * Errors encountered by the reconciliation operation are displayed in the grid and are available via the `cell.recon.error` GREL expression ([#3194](https://github.com/OpenRefine/OpenRefine/issues/3194), by @ayushrai206)
  * Those errors can also be isolated via facets ([#6232](https://github.com/OpenRefine/OpenRefine/issues/6232), @ayushrai206)
  * The interface to select a reconciliation service when reconciling was improved ([#6118](https://github.com/OpenRefine/OpenRefine/pull/6118), by @ayushrai206 and @Lydiaofficial)
  * The "Search for match" option is present in cells with reconciliation errors so that they can be fixed manually ([#6192](https://github.com/OpenRefine/OpenRefine/pull/6192), by @ayushrai206)
  * The error messages generated during reconciling are more helpful ([#6111](https://github.com/OpenRefine/OpenRefine/issues/6111), by @ayushrai206)
  * A new operation to extract URLs for reconciled cells is available ([#5960](https://github.com/OpenRefine/OpenRefine/issues/5960), by @ayushrai206)
  * Property selection in the reconciliation dialog gives better feedback to the user about whether a column is successfully mapped to a property or not ([#6060](https://github.com/OpenRefine/OpenRefine/pull/6060), by @elebitzero)
  * Type selection is similarly improved ([#6131](https://github.com/OpenRefine/OpenRefine/pull/6131), by @elebitzero)
  * Only up to three reconciliation candidates are displayed by default, with the option to see more ([#6154](https://github.com/OpenRefine/OpenRefine/issues/6154), by @ayushrai206 and @Lydiaofficial)
  * A [new design for the reconciliation dialog was proposed](https://forum.openrefine.org/t/update-on-column-mappings-reconciliation-dialog-redesign/1112) but has not been implemented yet. Your opinion about it is welcome on the forum. By @Lydiaofficial
  * It is possible to discover the source of a column obtained by fetching data from a reconciliation service, by hovering the column header ([#5130](https://github.com/OpenRefine/OpenRefine/issues/5130), by @ayushrai206)

### Facet improvements
  * The height of text facets is fitted to their contents ([#5514](https://github.com/OpenRefine/OpenRefine/pull/5514), by @elebitzero)
  * The text facet windows to their content ([#5513](https://github.com/OpenRefine/OpenRefine/issues/5513), by @elebitzero)
  * The facets panel does not shift vertically on refresh ([#5610](https://github.com/OpenRefine/OpenRefine/issues/5610), by @elebitzero)

### Improvements to linking to specific parts of OpenRefine via URLs
  * It is possible to link to a given home screen panel ([#5597](https://github.com/OpenRefine/OpenRefine/pull/5597), by @Abbe98)
  * The tags used to filter projects are also reflected in the URL ([#5769](https://github.com/OpenRefine/OpenRefine/pull/5769), by @Abbe98)

### Layout improvements to the Wikibase extension
  * Layout improvements in the Wikibase schema editor fixes ([#5449](https://github.com/OpenRefine/OpenRefine/issues/5449), by @prashasti-7)
  * The Wikibase issues tab displays the number of schema validation errors ([#5358](https://github.com/OpenRefine/OpenRefine/issues/5358), by @SoniaSun810)
  * The list of available Wikibase schemas is numbered ([#5893](https://github.com/OpenRefine/OpenRefine/issues/5893), by @Hisiste)
  * Wikibase: Layout and label changes to schema alignment tab ([#5346](https://github.com/OpenRefine/OpenRefine/issues/5346), by @Abbe98 and @lozanaross)
  * Clicking on the triangle unfolds Wikibase references in the schema editor ([#6304](https://github.com/OpenRefine/OpenRefine/issues/6304), by @amparab and @cooperzoe)

### Other improvements
* Applying a list of operations stored in a JSON file is possible without copy and paste ([#5022](https://github.com/OpenRefine/OpenRefine/issues/5022) by @IjayAbby)
* The cluster choice limit is configurable via the preferences ([#5847](https://github.com/OpenRefine/OpenRefine/pull/5847), by @5tigerjelly)
* The metadata dialog shows JSON contents in a more readable way ([#5870](https://github.com/OpenRefine/OpenRefine/pull/5870), by @Abbe98)
* OpenRefine is known to be compatible with Java versions 11 to 21 ([#5930](https://github.com/OpenRefine/OpenRefine/pull/5930), by @wetneb)
* URIs with the `geo:` protocol are rendered as links in cells ([#5940](https://github.com/OpenRefine/OpenRefine/pull/5940), by @Abbe98)
* Project archives can be imported via URL ([#5431](https://github.com/OpenRefine/OpenRefine/issues/5431), by @SoniaSun810)
* A Windows installer is available on top of the existing zip distribution. We no longer publish zip distribution without embedded Java. Do [let us know](https://forum.openrefine.org/t/releasing-3-8-beta1/1136/4) if this is a problem for you. ([#3224](https://github.com/OpenRefine/OpenRefine/issues/3224), by @dori4n)
* CSV Byte Order Mark (BOM) is supported  ([#1241](https://github.com/OpenRefine/OpenRefine/issues/1241), by @tfmorris)
* More HTTP headers are supported when fetching a column via URLs ([#6334](https://github.com/OpenRefine/OpenRefine/issues/6334), by @tfmorris)
* Columns can be expanded with a more easily identifiable button ([#5879](https://github.com/OpenRefine/OpenRefine/issues/5879), by @VhugoJc)
* TSV export avoids adding unneccessary quotes around cells ([#2071](https://github.com/OpenRefine/OpenRefine/issues/2071), by @tfmorris)

## GREL changes
* The `forRange` GREL function accepts negative increments ([#5520](https://github.com/OpenRefine/OpenRefine/issues/5520), by @Huishin-pie)
* Accessing the `record` & `columnNames` fields works again ([#5633](https://github.com/OpenRefine/OpenRefine/issues/5633), by @tfmorris)
* The `split()` function filters trailing empty token when there is a trailing string separator and leading empty token when there is a leading pattern separator match ([#5587](https://github.com/OpenRefine/OpenRefine/issues/5587), by @tfmorris)
* The `replaceEach()` function is more faithful to its documentation ([#5463](https://github.com/OpenRefine/OpenRefine/issues/5463), by @Huishin-pie)
* The `cross()` function returns an empty list on no match ([#5531](https://github.com/OpenRefine/OpenRefine/issues/5531), by @jenny-Musah)
* The `length()` function returns the number of keys in object ([#5991](https://github.com/OpenRefine/OpenRefine/issues/5991), by @tfmorris)
* The `forEachIndex()` control supports JSON objects and arrays ([#3147](https://github.com/OpenRefine/OpenRefine/issues/3147), by @tfmorris)
* Controls (`+` and comparison operators such as `<`) have less unexpected behaviors ([#6340](https://github.com/OpenRefine/OpenRefine/issues/6340)
, [#6341](https://github.com/OpenRefine/OpenRefine/issues/6341), by @tfmorris)

## Bug fixes
* The reconciliation dialog does not suggest properties specific to a type when "No Type" is selected ([#5523](https://github.com/OpenRefine/OpenRefine/issues/5523), by @tfmorris)
* The word facet uses an internationalized word separator instead of just space characters ([#557](https://github.com/OpenRefine/OpenRefine/issues/557), by @tfmorris)
* The HTTP proxy configuration is correctly handled ([#5476](https://github.com/OpenRefine/OpenRefine/issues/5476), by @tledoux)
* The 'Facet choices' dialog does not bleed over the dialog window on resize. ([#5619](https://github.com/OpenRefine/OpenRefine/pull/5619), by @elebitzero)
* The memory usage display shows up correctly on project creation ([#5665](https://github.com/OpenRefine/OpenRefine/issues/5665), by @elebitzero)
* The readability of the no-projects message is improved ([#5679](https://github.com/OpenRefine/OpenRefine/pull/5679), by @Abbe98)
* The visual style of the database import panel is more consistent with the rest of the application ([#5548](https://github.com/OpenRefine/OpenRefine/issues/5548), by @Abbe98)
* Dialogs cannot be dragged past the top of the window ([#5714](https://github.com/OpenRefine/OpenRefine/issues/5714), by @elebitzero)
* The clipboard import input does not overflow in narrow windows ([#5753](https://github.com/OpenRefine/OpenRefine/pull/5753), by @Abbe98)
* File upload buttons have a style that is consistent with other buttons ([#5743](https://github.com/OpenRefine/OpenRefine/issues/5743), by @Abbe98)
* Errors in preference changes are properly reported ([#5772](https://github.com/OpenRefine/OpenRefine/issues/5772), [#5785](https://github.com/OpenRefine/OpenRefine/pull/5785), by @tsukipedia and @tfmorris)
* Numeric facets are properly refreshed when switching tabs ([#5781](https://github.com/OpenRefine/OpenRefine/pull/5781), by @elebitzero)
* Manages importing URL with illegal characters. ([#4625](https://github.com/OpenRefine/OpenRefine/issues/4625), by @yeungven)
* The auto-completion for fields in the Wikibase schema conforms to the new MediaWiki API ([#5716](https://github.com/OpenRefine/OpenRefine/issues/5716), by @SoniaSun810)
* When removing rows, the cache of facet counts is correctly updated, updating the duplicates facet as well ([#5799](https://github.com/OpenRefine/OpenRefine/issues/5799), by @tfmorris)
* Column names are correctly quoted in the SQL exporter ([#5388](https://github.com/OpenRefine/OpenRefine/issues/5388), by @mahikaajain)
* The star/flag action correctly updates the row without reverting reconciliation changes ([#5738](https://github.com/OpenRefine/OpenRefine/issues/5738), by @SoniaSun810)
* The pointer cursor only changes when hovering the column menu, not the entire column headers ([#5977](https://github.com/OpenRefine/OpenRefine/issues/5977), by @Abbe98)
* The "Use quote as separator" defaults to False for TSV import ([#3853](https://github.com/OpenRefine/OpenRefine/issues/3853), by @jnchen1)
* The "Transpose cells across columns" treats blank cells like null cells ([#5229](https://github.com/OpenRefine/OpenRefine/issues/5229), by @skhoylow8)
* Wikibase edits on deleted items are skipped ([#5385](https://github.com/OpenRefine/OpenRefine/issues/5385), by @wetneb)
* The OpenRefine launcher on Windows no longer refuses to start if the Java version is too high ([#5583](https://github.com/OpenRefine/OpenRefine/issues/5583), by @wetneb)
* Reconciliation services can no longer be added multiple times ([#5926](https://github.com/OpenRefine/OpenRefine/issues/5926), by @tsukipedia)
* The SQL importer no longer checks for particular keywords in the query ([#6019](https://github.com/OpenRefine/OpenRefine/issues/6019), by @tfmorris)
* The allowed characters in file names of media uploads to Wikibase file are extended ([#5656](https://github.com/OpenRefine/OpenRefine/issues/5656), by @santi4o and @wetneb)
* Case sensitive sort of rows works as expected ([#6047](https://github.com/OpenRefine/OpenRefine/issues/6047), by @tfmorris)
* Missing spaces in facet sorting and "add column based on reconciled values" dialog are back ([#6047](https://github.com/OpenRefine/OpenRefine/issues/6047), [#6143](https://github.com/OpenRefine/OpenRefine/issues/6143), by @frafra and @SrinathKadam048)
* The URL fetching operation returns an error, not null, on a bad URL ([#6137](https://github.com/OpenRefine/OpenRefine/issues/6137), by @tfmorris)
* Bzip2 import works again now supports concatenated compressed streams ([#6129](https://github.com/OpenRefine/OpenRefine/issues/6129), by @tfmorris)
* Dates on Open Project page are localized ([#6172](https://github.com/OpenRefine/OpenRefine/issues/6172), by @tfmorris)
* Text in alert dialogs is selectable ([#6187](https://github.com/OpenRefine/OpenRefine/issues/6187), by @elebitzero)
* The grid is properly updated when a cell is matched ([#6236](https://github.com/OpenRefine/OpenRefine/issues/6236), by @elebitzero)
* The message shown at the top of the screen after operations has less encoding errors ([#6063](https://github.com/OpenRefine/OpenRefine/issues/6063), by @tfmorris)
* Setting the log level from the command line works again ([#6286](https://github.com/OpenRefine/OpenRefine/issues/6286), by @amparab)
* Creating a project from a URL with trailing whitespace no longer fails ([#6330](https://github.com/OpenRefine/OpenRefine/issues/6330), by @surajbora59)
* A spurious warning about missing units in the Wikibase extension was removed ([#5452](https://github.com/OpenRefine/OpenRefine/issues/5452), by @payalsaraljain)
* The `./refine` script ignores HTTP proxies for querying OpenRefine directly ([#2000](https://github.com/OpenRefine/OpenRefine/issues/2000), by @tejasbhosale17)

## Performance improvements
* We are now using the uniVocity CSV parser instead of the Apache Commons CSV parser. Beyond the performance improvements this brings, it is likely that this change comes with different parsing behaviour in some cases. Do let us know if those seem to be regressions ([#2268](https://github.com/OpenRefine/OpenRefine/issues/2268), [#1372](https://github.com/OpenRefine/OpenRefine/issues/1372), by @tfmorris)
* Project initialization is faster by sending parallel requests from the frontend ([#5941](https://github.com/OpenRefine/OpenRefine/pull/5941), by @Abbe98)
* The metadata files of projects are only written when needed ([#3805](https://github.com/OpenRefine/OpenRefine/issues/3805), by @ComgLq24)
* Newly read projects are not written before they're modified ([#3805](https://github.com/OpenRefine/OpenRefine/issues/3805), by @tfmorris)
* Jython interpeter is not initialized during startup but only the first time it is used ([#6174](https://github.com/OpenRefine/OpenRefine/issues/6174), by @tfmorris)
* The clustering dialog no longer runs the default clustering method by default to avoid unnecessary heavy computations on large projects ([#241](https://github.com/OpenRefine/OpenRefine/issues/241), by @elebitzero)

## For developers
* The timestamps for project changes have been migrated to UTC time objects ([#3047](https://github.com/OpenRefine/OpenRefine/issues/3047)), Switch HistoryEntry to Instant from OffsetDateTime(at UTC) ([#6176](https://github.com/OpenRefine/OpenRefine/pull/6176))
* We migrated from using `.less` to `.css` for our stylesheets. Extensions should still be able to use `.less` but are encouraged to migrate to using CSS variables instead ([#5525](https://github.com/OpenRefine/OpenRefine/pull/5525)). This is part of an ongoing effort to offer a dark mode ([#3017](https://github.com/OpenRefine/OpenRefine/pull/3017), by @Abbe98 and @elebitzero)
* Extensions can now register commands which can respond to HTTP HEAD requests ([#6097](https://github.com/OpenRefine/OpenRefine/pull/6097), by @Abbe98)
* The `get-all-preferences-command` now respond to HTTP GET requests. HTTP POST requests are still supported but extensions and clients are encouraged to migrate ([#5850](https://github.com/OpenRefine/OpenRefine/pull/5850), by @Abbe98)
* The `create-project-from-upload` command can now be used to set a project description and creator ([#5739](https://github.com/OpenRefine/OpenRefine/pull/5739), by @Abbe98)
* It is now optional for action areas to implement a resize function ([#5598](https://github.com/OpenRefine/OpenRefine/pull/5598), by @Abbe98)
* Project tags are expose in a data attribute ([#5590](https://github.com/OpenRefine/OpenRefine/pull/5590), by @Abbe98)
* Commands can now support the HTTP HEAD request type ([#6097](https://github.com/OpenRefine/OpenRefine/pull/6097), by @Abbe98)
* SVG images are supported in Butterfly ([simile-butterfly#90](https://github.com/OpenRefine/simile-butterfly/pull/90), by @Abbe98)

result.name: OpenRefine v3.7.9
result.description:
This is the ninth stable release of the 3.7 series. Please [backup your workspace directory](https://docs.openrefine.org/manual/installing#set-where-data-is-stored) before installing and report any problems that you encounter.

## New in 3.7.9

Signing of the MacOS package was fixed.

## Vulnerabilities

* (fixed since 3.7.8) The fix for the MySQL vulnerabilities CVE-2023-41886 and CVE-2023-41887 was corrected, as it still allowed reading arbitrary files or executing code on the machine running OpenRefine using a different set of import parameters in the database extension. This problem bears the vulnerability id CVE-2024-23833, reported by @l0n3rs.
* (fixed since 3.7.5) A moderate vulnerabilities in the database extension was fixed. Connecting to a malicious MySQL server could read files or execute arbitrary code on the machine running OpenRefine. The vulnerabilities were assigned CVE-2023-41886 and CVE-2023-41887
  identifiers respectively, and were reported by @nbxiglk0.
* (fixed since 3.7.4) A moderate vulnerability in project import was fixed. Importing a maliciously crafted project could execute arbitrary code on the machine running OpenRefine. This vulnerability has been assigned the CVE-2023-37476 identifier. It was reported by Stefan Schiller from SonarSource.

## New features
* Most text exposed to users in OpenRefine's UI can now be translated. Some strings (generated server-side) were not translatable so far. To help translators catch up on this backlog, do not hesitate to [join us on Weblate](https://hosted.weblate.org/engage/openrefine/). ([#5030](https://github.com/OpenRefine/OpenRefine/pull/5030))
* New media files can be uploaded to Wikibase instances such as Wikimedia Commons. The wikitext of existing files can also be edited thanks to the new fields introduced. ([#4682](https://github.com/OpenRefine/OpenRefine/issues/4682))
* A button "Discover Wikibase instances…" was added on the dialog which lists the registered Wikibase instances ([#5007](https://github.com/OpenRefine/OpenRefine/issues/5007)), whose design was improved ([#5009](https://github.com/OpenRefine/OpenRefine/issues/5009))
* In the Wikibase schema editor, statements with non-standard datatypes (such as EDTF dates or musical notations) are now supported, assuming they use strings as underlying representation ([#3263](https://github.com/OpenRefine/OpenRefine/issues/3263))
* The Wikibase issues tab now makes it possible to locate which rows are responsible for certain issues, using facets ([#5033](https://github.com/OpenRefine/OpenRefine/issues/5033))
* The default throttle delay for the "Add column by fetching URLs" operation was reduced to 500ms and the error reporting for this field was improved ([#5188](https://github.com/OpenRefine/OpenRefine/issues/5188))
* Wikibase templates (incomplete Wikibase schemas) can be saved and shared, as a way of helping contributors use the same way of structuring data in a Wikibase instance ([#5043](https://github.com/OpenRefine/OpenRefine/issues/5043), [#5303](https://github.com/OpenRefine/OpenRefine/pull/5303))
* The line-based importer now supports a custom delimiter, instead of only newlines ([#4103](https://github.com/OpenRefine/OpenRefine/issues/4103))
* The Excel importer can be configured to import all cells as text, disabling the use of other datatypes supported by OpenRefine ([#4838](https://github.com/OpenRefine/OpenRefine/issues/4838))
* The "some value" and "no value" Wikibase values can now be uploaded by OpenRefine ([#5360](https://github.com/OpenRefine/OpenRefine/pull/5360))
* The Excel importer will also avoid coercing cell values to OpenRefine datatypes which do not fully fit them, such as representing a date as a date with time ([#5389](https://github.com/OpenRefine/OpenRefine/issues/5389), [#5390](https://github.com/OpenRefine/OpenRefine/issues/5390)).


## GREL changes
* Improved error handling in number formatting with the GREL `toString` function ([#816](https://github.com/OpenRefine/OpenRefine/issues/816))
* The behaviour of the GREL function `wholeText()` has changed slightly in the way it handles newlines, following [an upstream change in the jsoup library](https://jsoup.org/news/release-1.15.1) (jsoup issue [#1636](https://github.com/jhy/jsoup/issues/1636))
* A new `parent` GREL function, to obtain the parent element of an XML element, was added ([#5176](https://github.com/OpenRefine/OpenRefine/issues/5176))

## Bug fixes
* The layout of the dialog to select a reconciliation match was improved so that the auto-complete widget does not hide the other options ([#4821](https://github.com/OpenRefine/OpenRefine/issues/4821))
* Better in-tool documentation around the way the scatterplot facet detects numerical columns ([#4890](https://github.com/OpenRefine/OpenRefine/issues/4890))
* The detection of URLs in cell values was fixed ([#4546](https://github.com/OpenRefine/OpenRefine/issues/4546))
* The error message displayed when trying to add a Wikibase manifest with a manifest version that is too old or recent was improved ([#4847](https://github.com/OpenRefine/OpenRefine/issues/4847))
* Errors returned by Jython expressions are more readable ([#3012](https://github.com/OpenRefine/OpenRefine/issues/3012))
* The ODS exporter no longer creates a default sheet "Sheet1" in the documents it creates ([#4864](https://github.com/OpenRefine/OpenRefine/issues/4864))
* Longer descriptions in auto-completion widget are not cut off anymore ([#4988](https://github.com/OpenRefine/OpenRefine/issues/4988))
* The interface for editing cell values was improved to better explain how to input dates ([#3082](https://github.com/OpenRefine/OpenRefine/issues/3082))
* The Windows `refine.bat` script was made more consistent with the Unix `refine` script ([#4949](https://github.com/OpenRefine/OpenRefine/pull/4949), [#5404](https://github.com/OpenRefine/OpenRefine/pull/5404))
* The "Search for Match" dialog was rearranged so that the dropdown does not cover the buttons ([#4945](https://github.com/OpenRefine/OpenRefine/pull/4945))
* Error handling in the scatterplot facet was improved ([#4893](https://github.com/OpenRefine/OpenRefine/pull/4893))
* The "Collapse consecutive whitespaces" operation now handles unicode whitespace correctly ([#4898](https://github.com/OpenRefine/OpenRefine/pull/4898))
* ([#4991](https://github.com/OpenRefine/OpenRefine/pull/4991))
* The handling of GZIP-compressed files without `.gz` extension was improved in the importing pipeline ([#547](https://github.com/OpenRefine/OpenRefine/pull/547))
* ([#5153](https://github.com/OpenRefine/OpenRefine/pull/5153))
* The "Add column based on this column dialog" can be submitted by pressing "Enter" in the column field ([#5143](https://github.com/OpenRefine/OpenRefine/issues/5143))
* The editing of redirected Wikibase items was fixed ([#5162](https://github.com/OpenRefine/OpenRefine/issues/5162))
* The user experience was improved in the case of incomplete Wikibase schemas ([#5131](https://github.com/OpenRefine/OpenRefine/issues/5131))
* The memory usage display was improved to show the used memory instead of the total memory, and was made more precise ([#5222](https://github.com/OpenRefine/OpenRefine/pull/5222))
* The association of labels to form inputs was improved, enhancing the accessibility of the interface ([#5239](https://github.com/OpenRefine/OpenRefine/pull/5239), [#5242](https://github.com/OpenRefine/OpenRefine/pull/5242), [#5249](https://github.com/OpenRefine/OpenRefine/pull/5249), [#5284](https://github.com/OpenRefine/OpenRefine/pull/5284))
* An overflow issue in the reconciliation dialog was fixed ([#5285](https://github.com/OpenRefine/OpenRefine/issues/5285))
* The Wikibase manifests now properly support locally-running reconciliation endpoints ([#5035](https://github.com/OpenRefine/OpenRefine/issues/5285))
* The aspect ratio of Wikibase logos is now properly preserved ([#5306](https://github.com/OpenRefine/OpenRefine/issues/5306))
* The SQL exporter interface was improved ([#5224](https://github.com/OpenRefine/OpenRefine/issues/5224))
* The cell edit popup and dialogs with textbox inputs became resizable ([#5330](https://github.com/OpenRefine/OpenRefine/pull/5330))
* When marking a set of cells as "New" in an unreconciled column, the user is prompted for the reconciliation service to use ([#4985](https://github.com/OpenRefine/OpenRefine/issues/4985))
* More quality assurance checks were introduced in the Wikibase extension, such as checking for identical label and description in new Wikibase items ([#4980](https://github.com/OpenRefine/OpenRefine/issues/4980))
* The caching of auto-completion results in the Wikibase extension was fixed ([#5190](https://github.com/OpenRefine/OpenRefine/issues/5190))
* The Wikidata extension was fully renamed to "Wikibase extension" ([#4525](https://github.com/OpenRefine/OpenRefine/issues/4525))
* The controls of the cluster and edit dialog are greyed out while clustering is taking place ([#5369](https://github.com/OpenRefine/OpenRefine/pull/5369))
* The handling of unicode whitespace was improved throughout the application ([#5105](https://github.com/OpenRefine/OpenRefine/issues/5105))
* Our MacOS packages (.DMG) are now properly signed and notarized, which should make their installation easier ([#4586](https://github.com/OpenRefine/OpenRefine/issues/4586)). Also, the presentation of the DMG image was made more user-friendly by including the customary link to the Applications folder. ([#5509](https://github.com/OpenRefine/OpenRefine/issues/5509))
* The parsing of the unary minus sign in GREL was fixed ([#5465](https://github.com/OpenRefine/OpenRefine/issues/5465))
* (From 3.7-beta3 on) The clustering dialog no longer introduces non-breaking spaces when selecting options with spaces in them ([#5581](https://github.com/OpenRefine/OpenRefine/issues/5581))
* (From 3.7.1 on) The display of the memory usage during project import was fixed ([#5665](https://github.com/OpenRefine/OpenRefine/issues/5665))
* (From 3.7.2 on) The localization in German was fixed ([#5750](https://github.com/OpenRefine/OpenRefine/issues/5750))
* (From 3.7.3 on) Starting openrefine.exe on Windows with Java 17 was fixed ([#5583](https://github.com/OpenRefine/OpenRefine/issues/5583))
* (From 3.7.3 on) Wikibase edits on deleted items are skipped and do not stall the entire batch ([#5385](https://github.com/OpenRefine/OpenRefine/issues/5385)) 
* (From 3.7.3 on) The HTML document language is aligned with the language of the interface ([#5925](https://github.com/OpenRefine/OpenRefine/pull/5925))
* (From 3.7.3 on) The default reconciliation types are displayed with both name and id ([#5907](https://github.com/OpenRefine/OpenRefine/issues/5907))
* (From 3.7.3 on) The transpose cells across columns was fixed so it treats blank cells as null ([#5229](https://github.com/OpenRefine/OpenRefine/issues/5229))
* (from 3.7.6 on) A missing space was added in the layout of the text facet, by @frafra ([#6071](https://github.com/OpenRefine/OpenRefine/issues/6071))
* (from 3.7.6 on) Browser launching on startup was fixed for Snap-packaged OpenRefine, by @kristbaum ([#6065](https://github.com/OpenRefine/OpenRefine/pull/6065))
* (from 3.7.6 on) The selection of Wikibase statement merging strategies was fixed, by @wetneb ([#6066](https://github.com/OpenRefine/OpenRefine/pull/6066))
* (from 3.7.6 on) A resizing issue in the presence of the Wikibase extension and facets was fixed, by @Abbe98 ([#6070](https://github.com/OpenRefine/OpenRefine/issues/6070))
* (from 3.7.7 on) A rendering issue in the Wikibase schema editor was fixed, by @wetneb ([#6165](https://github.com/OpenRefine/OpenRefine/pull/6165))
* (from 3.7.7 on) Attempts to fetch invalid URLs in the "Add column by fetching URLs" operation are properly reported to the user, by @tfmorris  ([#6141](https://github.com/OpenRefine/OpenRefine/pull/6141))
* (from 3.7.7 on) A missing space between the "remove" and "configure" buttons of the "Add column from reconciled values" operation was added, by @SrinathKadam048 ([#6151](https://github.com/OpenRefine/OpenRefine/pull/6151))

* The controls of the cluster and edit dialog are greyed out while clustering is taking place ([#5369](https://github.com/OpenRefine/OpenRefine/pull/5369))
* The handling of unicode whitespace was improved throughout the application ([#5105](https://github.com/OpenRefine/OpenRefine/issues/5105))
* Our MacOS packages (.DMG) are now properly signed and notarized, which should make their installation easier ([#4586](https://github.com/OpenRefine/OpenRefine/issues/4586)). Also, the presentation of the DMG image was made more user-friendly by including the customary link to the Applications folder. ([#5509](https://github.com/OpenRefine/OpenRefine/issues/5509))
* The parsing of the unary minus sign in GREL was fixed ([#5465](https://github.com/OpenRefine/OpenRefine/issues/5465))
* (From 3.7-beta3 on) The clustering dialog no longer introduces non-breaking spaces when selecting options with spaces in them ([#5581](https://github.com/OpenRefine/OpenRefine/issues/5581))
* (From 3.7.1 on) The display of the memory usage during project import was fixed ([#5665](https://github.com/OpenRefine/OpenRefine/issues/5665))
* (From 3.7.2 on) The localization in German was fixed ([#5750](https://github.com/OpenRefine/OpenRefine/issues/5750))
* (From 3.7.3 on) Starting openrefine.exe on Windows with Java 17 was fixed ([#5583](https://github.com/OpenRefine/OpenRefine/issues/5583))
* (From 3.7.3 on) Wikibase edits on deleted items are skipped and do not stall the entire batch ([#5385](https://github.com/OpenRefine/OpenRefine/issues/5385)) 
* (From 3.7.3 on) The HTML document language is aligned with the language of the interface ([#5925](https://github.com/OpenRefine/OpenRefine/pull/5925))
* (From 3.7.3 on) The default reconciliation types are displayed with both name and id ([#5907](https://github.com/OpenRefine/OpenRefine/issues/5907))
* (From 3.7.3 on) The transpose cells across columns was fixed so it treats blank cells as null ([#5229](https://github.com/OpenRefine/OpenRefine/issues/5229))
* (from 3.7.6 on) A missing space was added in the layout of the text facet, by @frafra ([#6071](https://github.com/OpenRefine/OpenRefine/issues/6071))
* (from 3.7.6 on) Browser launching on startup was fixed for Snap-packaged OpenRefine, by @kristbaum ([#6065](https://github.com/OpenRefine/OpenRefine/pull/6065))
* (from 3.7.6 on) The selection of Wikibase statement merging strategies was fixed, by @wetneb ([#6066](https://github.com/OpenRefine/OpenRefine/pull/6066))
* (from 3.7.6 on) A resizing issue in the presence of the Wikibase extension and facets was fixed, by @Abbe98 ([#6070](https://github.com/OpenRefine/OpenRefine/issues/6070))
* (from 3.7.7 on) A rendering issue in the Wikibase schema editor was fixed, by @wetneb ([#6165](https://github.com/OpenRefine/OpenRefine/pull/6165))
* (from 3.7.7 on) Attempts to fetch invalid URLs in the "Add column by fetching URLs" operation are properly reported to the user, by @tfmorris  ([#6141](https://github.com/OpenRefine/OpenRefine/pull/6141))
* (from 3.7.7 on) A missing space between the "remove" and "configure" buttons of the "Add column from reconciled values" operation was added, by @SrinathKadam048 ([#6151](https://github.com/OpenRefine/OpenRefine/pull/6151))

result.name: OpenRefine v3.7.7
result.description:
This is the seventh stable release of the 3.7 series. Please [backup your workspace directory](https://docs.openrefine.org/manual/installing#set-where-data-is-stored) before installing and report any problems that you encounter.

## New in 3.7.7

* A rendering issue in the Wikibase schema editor was fixed, by @wetneb ([#6165](https://github.com/OpenRefine/OpenRefine/pull/6165))
* Attempts to fetch invalid URLs in the "Add column by fetching URLs" operation are properly reported to the user, by @tfmorris  ([#6141](https://github.com/OpenRefine/OpenRefine/pull/6141))
* A missing space between the "remove" and "configure" buttons of the "Add column from reconciled values" operation was added, by @SrinathKadam048 ([#6151](https://github.com/OpenRefine/OpenRefine/pull/6151))

## Vulnerabilities

* (fixed since 3.7.5) A moderate vulnerabilities in the database extension was fixed. Connecting to a malicious MySQL server could read files or execute arbitrary code on the machine running OpenRefine. The vulnerabilities were assigned CVE-2023-41886 and CVE-2023-41887
  identifiers respectively, and were reported by @nbxiglk0.
* (fixed since 3.7.4) A moderate vulnerability in project import was fixed. Importing a maliciously crafted project could execute arbitrary code on the machine running OpenRefine. This vulnerability has been assigned the CVE-2023-37476 identifier. It was reported by Stefan Schiller from SonarSource.

## New features
* Most text exposed to users in OpenRefine's UI can now be translated. Some strings (generated server-side) were not translatable so far. To help translators catch up on this backlog, do not hesitate to [join us on Weblate](https://hosted.weblate.org/engage/openrefine/). ([#5030](https://github.com/OpenRefine/OpenRefine/pull/5030))
* New media files can be uploaded to Wikibase instances such as Wikimedia Commons. The wikitext of existing files can also be edited thanks to the new fields introduced. ([#4682](https://github.com/OpenRefine/OpenRefine/issues/4682))
* A button "Discover Wikibase instances…" was added on the dialog which lists the registered Wikibase instances ([#5007](https://github.com/OpenRefine/OpenRefine/issues/5007)), whose design was improved ([#5009](https://github.com/OpenRefine/OpenRefine/issues/5009))
* In the Wikibase schema editor, statements with non-standard datatypes (such as EDTF dates or musical notations) are now supported, assuming they use strings as underlying representation ([#3263](https://github.com/OpenRefine/OpenRefine/issues/3263))
* The Wikibase issues tab now makes it possible to locate which rows are responsible for certain issues, using facets ([#5033](https://github.com/OpenRefine/OpenRefine/issues/5033))
* The default throttle delay for the "Add column by fetching URLs" operation was reduced to 500ms and the error reporting for this field was improved ([#5188](https://github.com/OpenRefine/OpenRefine/issues/5188))
* Wikibase templates (incomplete Wikibase schemas) can be saved and shared, as a way of helping contributors use the same way of structuring data in a Wikibase instance ([#5043](https://github.com/OpenRefine/OpenRefine/issues/5043), [#5303](https://github.com/OpenRefine/OpenRefine/pull/5303))
* The line-based importer now supports a custom delimiter, instead of only newlines ([#4103](https://github.com/OpenRefine/OpenRefine/issues/4103))
* The Excel importer can be configured to import all cells as text, disabling the use of other datatypes supported by OpenRefine ([#4838](https://github.com/OpenRefine/OpenRefine/issues/4838))
* The "some value" and "no value" Wikibase values can now be uploaded by OpenRefine ([#5360](https://github.com/OpenRefine/OpenRefine/pull/5360))
* The Excel importer will also avoid coercing cell values to OpenRefine datatypes which do not fully fit them, such as representing a date as a date with time ([#5389](https://github.com/OpenRefine/OpenRefine/issues/5389), [#5390](https://github.com/OpenRefine/OpenRefine/issues/5390)).


## GREL changes
* Improved error handling in number formatting with the GREL `toString` function ([#816](https://github.com/OpenRefine/OpenRefine/issues/816))
* The behaviour of the GREL function `wholeText()` has changed slightly in the way it handles newlines, following [an upstream change in the jsoup library](https://jsoup.org/news/release-1.15.1) (jsoup issue [#1636](https://github.com/jhy/jsoup/issues/1636))
* A new `parent` GREL function, to obtain the parent element of an XML element, was added ([#5176](https://github.com/OpenRefine/OpenRefine/issues/5176))

## Bug fixes
* The layout of the dialog to select a reconciliation match was improved so that the auto-complete widget does not hide the other options ([#4821](https://github.com/OpenRefine/OpenRefine/issues/4821))
* Better in-tool documentation around the way the scatterplot facet detects numerical columns ([#4890](https://github.com/OpenRefine/OpenRefine/issues/4890))
* The detection of URLs in cell values was fixed ([#4546](https://github.com/OpenRefine/OpenRefine/issues/4546))
* The error message displayed when trying to add a Wikibase manifest with a manifest version that is too old or recent was improved ([#4847](https://github.com/OpenRefine/OpenRefine/issues/4847))
* Errors returned by Jython expressions are more readable ([#3012](https://github.com/OpenRefine/OpenRefine/issues/3012))
* The ODS exporter no longer creates a default sheet "Sheet1" in the documents it creates ([#4864](https://github.com/OpenRefine/OpenRefine/issues/4864))
* Longer descriptions in auto-completion widget are not cut off anymore ([#4988](https://github.com/OpenRefine/OpenRefine/issues/4988))
* The interface for editing cell values was improved to better explain how to input dates ([#3082](https://github.com/OpenRefine/OpenRefine/issues/3082))
* The Windows `refine.bat` script was made more consistent with the Unix `refine` script ([#4949](https://github.com/OpenRefine/OpenRefine/pull/4949), [#5404](https://github.com/OpenRefine/OpenRefine/pull/5404))
* The "Search for Match" dialog was rearranged so that the dropdown does not cover the buttons ([#4945](https://github.com/OpenRefine/OpenRefine/pull/4945))
* Error handling in the scatterplot facet was improved ([#4893](https://github.com/OpenRefine/OpenRefine/pull/4893))
* The "Collapse consecutive whitespaces" operation now handles unicode whitespace correctly ([#4898](https://github.com/OpenRefine/OpenRefine/pull/4898))
* ([#4991](https://github.com/OpenRefine/OpenRefine/pull/4991))
* The handling of GZIP-compressed files without `.gz` extension was improved in the importing pipeline ([#547](https://github.com/OpenRefine/OpenRefine/pull/547))
* ([#5153](https://github.com/OpenRefine/OpenRefine/pull/5153))
* The "Add column based on this column dialog" can be submitted by pressing "Enter" in the column field ([#5143](https://github.com/OpenRefine/OpenRefine/issues/5143))
* The editing of redirected Wikibase items was fixed ([#5162](https://github.com/OpenRefine/OpenRefine/issues/5162))
* The user experience was improved in the case of incomplete Wikibase schemas ([#5131](https://github.com/OpenRefine/OpenRefine/issues/5131))
* The memory usage display was improved to show the used memory instead of the total memory, and was made more precise ([#5222](https://github.com/OpenRefine/OpenRefine/pull/5222))
* The association of labels to form inputs was improved, enhancing the accessibility of the interface ([#5239](https://github.com/OpenRefine/OpenRefine/pull/5239), [#5242](https://github.com/OpenRefine/OpenRefine/pull/5242), [#5249](https://github.com/OpenRefine/OpenRefine/pull/5249), [#5284](https://github.com/OpenRefine/OpenRefine/pull/5284))
* An overflow issue in the reconciliation dialog was fixed ([#5285](https://github.com/OpenRefine/OpenRefine/issues/5285))
* The Wikibase manifests now properly support locally-running reconciliation endpoints ([#5035](https://github.com/OpenRefine/OpenRefine/issues/5285))
* The aspect ratio of Wikibase logos is now properly preserved ([#5306](https://github.com/OpenRefine/OpenRefine/issues/5306))
* The SQL exporter interface was improved ([#5224](https://github.com/OpenRefine/OpenRefine/issues/5224))
* The cell edit popup and dialogs with textbox inputs became resizable ([#5330](https://github.com/OpenRefine/OpenRefine/pull/5330))
* When marking a set of cells as "New" in an unreconciled column, the user is prompted for the reconciliation service to use ([#4985](https://github.com/OpenRefine/OpenRefine/issues/4985))
* More quality assurance checks were introduced in the Wikibase extension, such as checking for identical label and description in new Wikibase items ([#4980](https://github.com/OpenRefine/OpenRefine/issues/4980))
* The caching of auto-completion results in the Wikibase extension was fixed ([#5190](https://github.com/OpenRefine/OpenRefine/issues/5190))
* The Wikidata extension was fully renamed to "Wikibase extension" ([#4525](https://github.com/OpenRefine/OpenRefine/issues/4525))
* The controls of the cluster and edit dialog are greyed out while clustering is taking place ([#5369](https://github.com/OpenRefine/OpenRefine/pull/5369))
* The handling of unicode whitespace was improved throughout the application ([#5105](https://github.com/OpenRefine/OpenRefine/issues/5105))
* Our MacOS packages (.DMG) are now properly signed and notarized, which should make their installation easier ([#4586](https://github.com/OpenRefine/OpenRefine/issues/4586)). Also, the presentation of the DMG image was made more user-friendly by including the customary link to the Applications folder. ([#5509](https://github.com/OpenRefine/OpenRefine/issues/5509))
* The parsing of the unary minus sign in GREL was fixed ([#5465](https://github.com/OpenRefine/OpenRefine/issues/5465))
* (From 3.7-beta3 on) The clustering dialog no longer introduces non-breaking spaces when selecting options with spaces in them ([#5581](https://github.com/OpenRefine/OpenRefine/issues/5581))
* (From 3.7.1 on) The display of the memory usage during project import was fixed ([#5665](https://github.com/OpenRefine/OpenRefine/issues/5665))
* (From 3.7.2 on) The localization in German was fixed ([#5750](https://github.com/OpenRefine/OpenRefine/issues/5750))
* (From 3.7.3 on) Starting openrefine.exe on Windows with Java 17 was fixed ([#5583](https://github.com/OpenRefine/OpenRefine/issues/5583))
* (From 3.7.3 on) Wikibase edits on deleted items are skipped and do not stall the entire batch ([#5385](https://github.com/OpenRefine/OpenRefine/issues/5385)) 
* (From 3.7.3 on) The HTML document language is aligned with the language of the interface ([#5925](https://github.com/OpenRefine/OpenRefine/pull/5925))
* (From 3.7.3 on) The default reconciliation types are displayed with both name and id ([#5907](https://github.com/OpenRefine/OpenRefine/issues/5907))
* (From 3.7.3 on) The transpose cells across columns was fixed so it treats blank cells as null ([#5229](https://github.com/OpenRefine/OpenRefine/issues/5229))
* (from 3.7.6 on) A missing space was added in the layout of the text facet, by @frafra ([#6071](https://github.com/OpenRefine/OpenRefine/issues/6071))
* (from 3.7.6 on) Browser launching on startup was fixed for Snap-packaged OpenRefine, by @kristbaum ([#6065](https://github.com/OpenRefine/OpenRefine/pull/6065))
* (from 3.7.6 on) The selection of Wikibase statement merging strategies was fixed, by @wetneb ([#6066](https://github.com/OpenRefine/OpenRefine/pull/6066))
* (from 3.7.6 on) A resizing issue in the presence of the Wikibase extension and facets was fixed, by @Abbe98 ([#6070](https://github.com/OpenRefine/OpenRefine/issues/6070))
